channel.description: Recent content on Future Leo's Blog

item.title: Journal Papers
item.description: As key contributor Li, J. Q.*, W. Liu, X. Yang, P. Lu, and K. C. P. Wang. 2022. “Statistical Safety Performance Models considering Pavement and Roadway Characteristics.” Journal of Advanced Transportation, 2022: e5871601. Hindawi. https://doi.org/10.1155/2022/5871601. Liu, W., J. Q. Li*, X. Yang, K. Wang, and W. Yu. 2022. “Integrating Skid Resistance and Safety Benefits into Life Cycle Cost Analysis for Pavement Surface Treatment Selection.” Journal of Transportation Engineering, Part B: Pavements, 148 (2): 04022015. American Society of Civil Engineers.

item.title: Project Reports and Proposals
item.description: Reports Joshua Q. Li, Kelvin C. P. Wang, Wenyao Liu, and Wenying Yu. 2021. “Utilizing Pavement Friction and Texture Data for the Reduction of Traffic Crashes and Delays.” Final Report FHWA-OK-21-01 (SP&R 2309). Oklahoma Department of Transportation (ODOT), Oklahoma City, OK. Joshua Q. Li, Kelvin C. P. Wang, Wenying Yu, Wenyao Liu. 2020. “Continuous Friction Measurement Equipment (CFME) for Highway Safety Management in Oklahoma.” Final Report FHWA-OK-20-02 (SP&R 2306). Oklahoma Department of Transportation (ODOT), Oklahoma City, OK.

item.title: Diagram Support
item.description: Eureka supports the rendering of diagrams by using Mermaid.

item.title: Math Support
item.description: Eureka supports the rendering of mathematical formulas by using KaTeX.

item.title: Peridynamics-based simulation of asphalt mixture cracking in semi-circular bending (SCB) test
item.description: In this project, peridynamics, a new fracture mechanics methodology that extends classical continuum mechanics to discontinuous material responses, is implemented to simulate crack propagation during the SCB testing process.

item.title: Peridynamics-based simulation of asphalt mixture cracking in semi-circular bending (SCB) test
item.description: In this project, peridynamics, a new fracture mechanics methodology that extends classical continuum mechanics to discontinuous material responses, is implemented to simulate crack propagation during the SCB testing process.

item.title: Peridynamics-based simulation of asphalt mixture cracking in semi-circular bending (SCB) test
item.description: In this project, peridynamics, a new fracture mechanics methodology that extends classical continuum mechanics to discontinuous material responses, is implemented to simulate crack propagation during the SCB testing process.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
